formatted_address: 91 Nanyang Ave, Gaia South Academic Building, Singapore 639956
name: Gaia - Nanyang Business School

reviews.text: The largest wooden building made from mass laminated timber in Asia. Built by famed Japanese architect Toyo Ito, it's like walking into a forest.
Beautiful and comforting architecture. A good example of blending nature beauty into modern buildings.

Very nice wooden architecture. Impressive. Windy and Zen.

IG/tiktok: gohht13

saw this sign at gaia building!

code choice and preference: words are written in all caps to index urgency! there are also no proper punctuation, it's just a block of text. there are symbols above the text so multiple modes are used. i'm guessing the arrow is to convey the direction... not sure about the arrows pointing towards the people sign?

inscription: the white font in caps is contrasted against a green background which is unusual because red usually indexes emergencies... design is simple and conveys the message. the arrow symbol is useful but not the other symbol.

Emplacement: placed at some random corridor at gaia, really missable. if this is an important sign, shouldn't it be highlighted more...? i dunno
Had a great time of short week here , enjoying the training here for fully sustainable   buildingâ€¦

vicinity: 91 Nanyang Avenue, Gaia South Academic Building, Singapore
